H0.text: Avoiding predators is what spider webs help spiders.

H1.text: Capture food is what spider webs help spiders.

H2.text: Spider webs help spiders stay dry.

H3.text: Keep warm is how spider webs help spiders.

A4.text: Webs allow a spider to catch prey without having to expend energy by running it down, making it an efficient method of gathering food.

A5.text: many day-hunting orb-web spinners reduce this risk by hiding at the edge of the web with one foot on a signal line from the hub or by appearing to be inedible or unappetizing.

A6.text: webs with twigs through their centers, possibly to hide the spiders from predators

A7.text: enabling oscillations to catch insects in slow horizontal flight
